intro: Cohniella biorbicularis, commonly known as the orbicular cohniella, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in southern Africa. It is characterized by its unique orbicular-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its botanical features include a short stem, waxy leaves, and pale yellow or greenish flowers. It is often found in open vegetation and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
